subject: Re: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()
msgSnippet: Take a look. There s quite a bit. Look at HTMLUnit, as well. Take care. So said Erik Mattsson on 4/26/2003 -------------------- ... don t want it too often, I
messageBody:
Take a look. There's quite a bit. Look at HTMLUnit, as well.

Take care.


So said Erik Mattsson on 4/26/2003 --------------------
> Avoid the problem entirely. Use GSBase's "EqualsTester".
>
> For my part, I wouldn't mind seeing assertNotEquals(), although I
don't want it too often, I do want it from time to time.
>
> Take care.

Ahh, thats what I was looking for also. I was missing some automated
way to test the equals() contract and test the hashcode at the same
time is great.

The equals contract assert would be nice to have in the JUnit API
and other contract checkers, for perhaps the hashcode, clone
etc. (And YES im reading the "Effective Java" book right now and
it is real good)

But still I havent had any good reason for that assertnotequals
is not part of the package.

BTW are there any other good stuff in the gsbade package?

//Erik
